member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain
member.summary: Represents a chain of drawers that can be iterated over during property drawing. This class implements both and interfaces to allow sequential iteration through drawers while automatically skipping drawers that should be skipped during the drawing process.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.Current
member.summary: Gets the current drawer in the iteration. Returns null if the iteration is before the first drawer or after the last drawer.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.Drawers
member.summary: Gets all drawers in this chain, including those that may be skipped during iteration.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.Property
member.summary: Gets the inspector property associated with this drawer chain.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.#ctor(EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorProperty,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IEasyDrawer})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DrawerChain class.
member.param: The inspector property this drawer chain is associated with.
The collection of drawers to include in the chain.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next drawer in the chain. Automatically skips drawers that have SkipWhenDrawing set to true.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next drawer; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first drawer in the chain.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through all drawers in the chain. This includes drawers that would normally be skipped during drawing.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through all drawers.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through all drawers in the chain.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through all drawers.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.DrawerChain.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Resets the enumerator position.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorHandlerUtility.GetMatchedType(EasyToolKit.Core.TypeMatchIndex,System.Type[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Resolves generic type arguments for inspector elements that target partially open generic types. This method handles complex scenarios where an inspector element's generic parameters correspond to specific type parameters within a partially concrete generic target type.
member.param: The type match index containing the inspector element type and its target generic type.
The target types to match against; expected to contain exactly one type (the actual value type).
Reference parameter that can be set to true to stop further matching (not used in this implementation).
member.returns: If the inspector element's target type is a (partially open) generic type and the actual value type can provide the missing generic arguments, returns the concretely instantiated inspector element type. Otherwise, returns null to indicate no match.

remarks.para: This method enables inspector elements to target complex generic types with mixed concrete and generic type parameters. For example, consider an inspector element type that draws values of a generic collection with a fixed key type:

Here, SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue> (matchIndex.Type) targets SerializedDictionary<string, TValue> (matchIndex.Targets[0]), which is a partially open generic type with a concrete key type (string) and a generic value type (TValue). The target type is obtained via during initialization: given SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue> and its base class EasyValueDrawer<SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>>, the method extracts the generic argument SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>.
When the actual value type is SerializedDictionary<string, int> (targets[0]), this method:

item.description: Validates there's exactly one target type and that the element's target is a generic type.
If the target is a completely concrete type (no generic parameters), requires exact type equality.

Otherwise, calls to extract the missing generic arguments: ResolveMissingGenericTypeArguments(SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>, SerializedDictionary<string, int>, false) returns [int], which is the concrete type for the parameter TValue.
If no arguments are missing (types already match or are incompatible), returns null.
Checks that SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue>'s generic constraints are satisfied by [int] via .
If all checks pass, constructs and returns SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<int> using .

remarks.para: This mechanism allows inspector elements to be automatically instantiated with the correct type arguments based on the actual runtime type of the property being inspected. It supports complex scenarios with multiple generic parameters, such as KeyValuePairDrawer<TKey, TValue> : EasyValueDrawer<KeyValuePair<int, TKey>> where only a subset of the target type's generic parameters correspond to the drawer's own generic parameters.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorProperty
member.summary:
Represents a property in the Unity inspector, providing access to property information, value management, drawing capabilities, and hierarchical property structure.
This class manages the lifecycle of inspector properties including initialization, value updates, drawing, and disposal. It supports property resolvers, attribute resolution, drawer chains, and grouping for complex inspector layouts.

member.summary: Gets the collection of child properties for this property, or null if this property has no children.

member.summary: Gets the metadata information about this property, including type information, member accessors, and resolver configuration.

member.summary: Gets or sets the GUI content used for displaying this property's label in the inspector. This includes the display text, tooltip, and optional icon for the property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times this property should be skipped during drawing. This is used for advanced drawing scenarios where properties need to be conditionally hidden.

member.typeparam: The type of group attribute this drawer handles.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyGroupAttributeDrawer`1.DrawProperty(UnityEngine.GUIContent)
member.summary: Draws the group property with foldout functionality. When the group is expanded, it draws the property and all properties in the group. When collapsed, it skips drawing the group properties.
member.param: The GUIContent label to display for this property.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyGroupAttributeDrawer`1.BeginDrawProperty(UnityEngine.GUIContent,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Called at the beginning of the group drawing process. Override this method to customize the group header appearance.
member.param: The GUIContent label for the group.
Reference to the foldout state. Modify this to control group expansion.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyGroupAttributeDrawer`1.EndDrawProperty
member.summary: Called at the end of the group drawing process. Override this method to add custom UI after the group content.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyMethodAttributeDrawer`1
member.summary: Base class for drawers that handle method attributes. Method attributes are applied to methods and can be used to create buttons or method call UI in the Inspector.
member.typeparam: The type of method attribute this drawer handles.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyMethodAttributeDrawer`1.MethodInfo
member.summary: Gets the MethodInfo for the method that this drawer is handling. The MethodInfo is lazily loaded from the property when first accessed.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyMethodAttributeDrawer`1.CanDrawAttributeProperty(EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorProperty)
member.summary: Determines whether this drawer can draw the specified attribute property. This method ensures that the property represents a method.
member.returns: True if the property represents a method, false otherwise.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyValueDrawer`1
member.summary: Base abstract class for drawers that handle specific value types. Provides strongly-typed access to property values with type safety.
member.typeparam: The type of value this drawer handles.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyValueDrawer`1.ValueEntry
member.summary: Gets the strongly-typed value entry for the property. The value entry is lazily loaded and will attempt to update the property if not found initially.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyValueDrawer`1.CanDrawProperty(EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorProperty)
member.summary: Determines whether this drawer can draw the specified property. This method is sealed and provides the base logic for value type-based property filtering.
member.returns: True if this drawer can handle the property, false otherwise.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyValueDrawer`1.CanDrawValueType(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether this drawer can draw properties of the specified value type. Override this method to restrict which value types this drawer can handle.
member.param: The type of the property value.
member.returns: True if this drawer can handle the value type, false otherwise.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.EasyValueDrawer`1.CanDrawValueProperty(EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.InspectorProperty)
member.summary: Determines whether this drawer can draw the specified value property. Override this method to implement custom value-based filtering logic.
member.returns: True if this drawer can handle the value property, false otherwise.

summary.para: Pops up an editor window for the given object in a drop-down window which closes when it loses its focus. This particular overload uses a few frames to calculate the height of the content before showing the window with a height that matches its content.
Protip: You can subscribe to OnClose if you want to know when that occurs.
